title: Authors and Citation
text: Wu W (2024). regmonkey: Quickly perform regression different variable combinations. R package version 0.0.0.9001.
code: @Manual{,   title = {regmonkey: Quickly perform regression on different variable combinations},   author = {Wenquan Wu},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9001}, }

what: Quickly perform regression on different variable combinations
title: Quickly perform regression on different variable combinations
text: goal regmonkey quickly performing batch regression different variable combinations different regression models, specifying necessary variables, significance levels, directions. output significant models regression.

title: Quickly perform regression on different variable combinations
text: can install development version regmonkey GitHub :

title: Quickly perform regression on different variable combinations
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: #library(regmonkey) df <- mtcars results <- regmonkey(   data = df,    dependent_var = "mpg",     independent_vars = c("cyl"),    control_vars = c("am"),   significance_level = 0.1 ) print(results)

title: RegMonkey: Automated Regression Analysis — regmonkey
text: function performs automated regression analysis iterating possible combinations control variables, without mandatory variables. assesses significance independent variables' effects dependent variable.

title: RegMonkey: Automated Regression Analysis — regmonkey
code: regmonkey(   data,   dependent_var,   independent_vars,   control_vars = NULL,   mandatory_vars = NULL,   significance_level = 0.05,   direction = "both" )

title: RegMonkey: Automated Regression Analysis — regmonkey
text: data data frame containing variables referenced formula. dependent_var string specifying name dependent variable. independent_vars character vector specifying names independent variables tested model. control_vars optional character vector control variables may included model. Default NULL. mandatory_vars optional character vector variables must always included controls every model tested. Default NULL. significance_level numeric value specifying significance level hypothesis test coefficients. Default 0.05. direction string indicating direction effect test: '' positive negative, 'positive' positive, 'negative' negative effects. Default ''.

title: RegMonkey: Automated Regression Analysis — regmonkey
text: list significant combinations. element list list containing independent variable controls found significant.

title: RegMonkey: Automated Regression Analysis — regmonkey
code: data <- data.frame(y = rnorm(100), x1 = rnorm(100), x2 = rnorm(100), x3 = rnorm(100)) significant_results <- regmonkey(data, "y", c("x1", "x2"), control_vars = c("x3")) #>  #> Processing independent variable: x1  #> Processing combination 1 of 2 :   #> Processing combination 2 of 2 : x3  #>  #> Processing independent variable: x2  #> Processing combination 1 of 2 :   #> Processing combination 2 of 2 : x3

what: Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
title: Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
text: function processes results regmonkey function, creating displaying regression models significant variable combination identified. utilizes modelsummary package format present results clearly, allowing easy evaluation significance impact various predictors.

title: Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
text: significant_results list significant variable combinations returned regmonkey. element list contain dependent variable, independent variable, controls significant result found. data data frame containing variables referenced regression formulas. coef_map_override optional named vector override default mapping coefficient names output. can used provide readable specific names variables regression output. provided, function automatically extract variable names models.

title: Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
text: function return anything; directly outputs regression results formatted modelsummary package R console R Markdown document.

title: Summarize and Display Regression Results — summary_reg
